meanings.definition: A person or thing that drains.
meanings.sent1: The sink in the kitchen has two drainers for dishes.
meanings.sent2: The plumber installed a new drainer in the shower to prevent clogging.
meanings.sent3: The drainers in the bathtub were so efficient that the water disappeared in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her constant complaints were like emotional drainers, sucking the joy out of the room.
meanings.sent5: The drainers in the garden were so effective that the soil remained perfectly dry.

meanings.definition: A device used to remove liquid or waste.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen sink came with a built-in drainer for excess water.
meanings.sent2: The janitor used a powerful drainer to clear the clogged drain in the restroom.
meanings.sent3: The automatic drainer in the dishwasher made cleaning up after dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The rain poured down like a giant drainer, clearing the streets of debris.
meanings.sent5: The industrial drainer in the factory could handle gallons of liquid waste in seconds.

meanings.definition: A person who causes exhaustion or fatigue.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, he felt like a mental drainer, unable to focus on anything.
meanings.sent2: The demanding boss was a constant drainer of his employees' energy.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner joked that the finish line was the ultimate drainer of his energy.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending meetings with no breaks were like time drainers, leaving everyone exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The draining heat of the desert sun acted as a physical drainer on the explorers.
